phrases: I wish you would have waited until after you were serialized before making an official announcement.
If I am going to do it, now is the only time.
This way all my fans will send in those questionnaires and give me votes.
By being successful in many different fields, I will become a person of real charisma!
Making an announcement at a time like this is unfair.
Yeah, he will definitely get questionnaires from his fans.
The work that comes in first in the Golden Future Cup gets closest to becoming serialized.
Even we want to be number one!
Let us go.
Guess the gang's all here.
We cannot let KOOGY's actions go by!
There is no way I could tolerate an announcement like that!
Let us make the editorial department open their eyes.
Fukuda Group, let us go!
Sorry to be so sudden,
but what business do you have at the company today?
I apologize for the inconvenience,
but the inside of the offices are not open to the public.
If you have an appointment, please see the receptionist over there and...
We have got business with the Jack editorial department.
We have filled out the entrance procedures and everything.
Oh, then excuse me.
What was with that guard?
He got oddly quiet.
Your sense of justice must have gotten through to him, Fukuda-san.
Must have.
Please wait at booth number one over there.
Thank you.
How may I help you-
An entrance procedure form, please.
Yes.
P-Please fill this out.
'Kay.
Which one of us has the highest ranking editor?
Aoki-san's editor is Aida-san, he is a captain.
We could just go straight up to the editor-in-chief.
Please call Weekly Shounen Jack's Aida-san.
So he is going with Aida-san?
If he is not there, call Hattori Akira-san.
And if that is still no good, try Hattori Yuujirou-san.
P-Please wait one moment.
Hello?
It is Aida.
Eh?
Yes.
Yes...
Fukuda-sama, Nakai-sama, and the two gentlemen Ashirogi-sama.
Four of them all together.
The entrants in the Golden Future Cup, huh?
It must be about that.
Send them up to the editorial department, please.
Hattori!
Yuujirou!
They are coming to raid us!
Letting that damn KOOGY have an entry...
We cannot let the Golden Future Cup turn into an ordinary popularity contest.
Right!
We put our souls into the manga we write, do not we?!
That is right!
Just you wait, Jack editorial department.
Fukuda-kun and the others are...
Yeah.
And I have got a pretty good idea as to why.
Sounds like it is going to get noisy.
Hello!
Excuse us!
It is so nice to be young.
One of them's not so young though...
Wait!
Fukuda-kun, stop!
I did not come here to talk to you, Yuujirou-san.
At the least, it will be with Aida-san-
Do not mess around here!
I will listen to what you have to say.
This is unfair.
Like I thought, that is what it is.
He is going to get votes just because he is KOOGY.
Whenever he releases a song, his CD sales and download counts are always in the top 3 nationwide.
And personally, I really do not want to lose to a work like Colorfusical.
Did Hattori-san know something like this would happen?
He is putting his music career on hiatus for this.
I do not think it is unfair at all.
In fact, the fans are more likely to want him to forget about manga and go back to making music.
And he will get a real bashing if his manga is not interesting.
That is how resolved he is to do this.
Then why the hell is he announcing it now?!
It is obviously that it is to get fans to support him in it, is not it?!
He even put in that I hope you will all support me!
comment.
And it even says that he is been saying that on all the music programs he is been on.
This is just like a celebrity running in an election because they know they will get votes!
Well, is there really anything wrong with that?
Even if that is what it takes to get results, being a mangaka is a job that relies on being popular.
The ones who get the popularity win.
Give
Me a break!
You think that regardless of what means you use, as long as you get the votes, it is all good Yuujirou-san?
Do not get violent!
I think Fukuda-san is right!
This way, the battle ends up not even being about manga.
And this time I am betting my life on my work.
I am not going to get another chance!
I am already 33!
If you do not like it, step down as an entry!
We have not announced what works the entries are yet!
KOOGY's the one who should step down!
It is already been on the news.
If we undo that, then it will turn into a real problem!
Then it will work if all three of us drop out?
Can you still do the Golden Future Cup then?
Hey Fukuda-kun, for us dropping out's a little...
Whose side are you on, Nakai-san?
We have got to stand firm here!
B-But...
There are other candidates who can fill your spots.
Tons of newcomers waiting for their chance!
Is that really how you are going to handle this as adults?
If it comes to it, we do not mind.
Our top priority is to make the readers happy!
A manga only needs to be interesting.
If it is interesting, of course it will get serialized.
Fukuda-san, we are not dropping out.
We just have to win, do not we?
We just need to win on the contents of our manga!
A manga just needs to be interesting.
Interesting works will get serialized.
Even if KOOGY's fans send in questionnaires and he wins the Cup,
that does not mean his work has real merit.
If we read them, we will be able to tell right away about who really won and lost.
So even if KOOGY's fans do send them in for him,
if we write manga that will not lost to him based on their contents, that should be fine!
You are just trying to say something cool,
but you are exactly right.
We will make this a battle of manga!
We will beat that Makaino Kouji, KOOGY into the ground!
Okay.
How about we three groups show each other our names?
Eh?
We will give each other our opinions and make them even better.
Like with chapter five of CROW.
There is nothing improper about this.
We are comrades before we are rivals, after all.
What do you think?
Hattori-san, could we have a copy of our name?
Sure.
Ah, Niizuma-kun?
Sorry to bother you, but I am going to bring Ashirogi-kun over there.
We want to have a strategy meeting for the Golden Future Cup.
Eh, Ashirogi-sensei?
So we will be heading back there now.
Roger.
Mm, yes.
So then we decided our three groups should exchange opinions...
Ah, Fukuda-kun!
It is all right if Aoki-san comes too, right?
Of course.
Yes, I am back.
He said it would be an honor to have you and he will wait for you to get there.
Ok, I will see you then.
Here are the copies.
Three of them.
Thank you.
Do not worry, the readers will judge them on their content.
Do your best!
Right!
Thank you very much.
Ready to go, Ashirogi-kun?
Ah, yes!
Okay, Fukuda Group, excuse us!
Sorry for the trouble.
Excuse us.
Excuse us.
Those guys are kind of a pain, are not they?
But if they do not try that much, they cannot become popular authors.
Yes, that is true.
It is true, even the sign's gone.
So the news was true?
It is such a shock...
But KOOGY is still KOOGY, I am going to support him.
He really is popular, is not he?
That KOOGY bastard, he is underestimating manga.
There is no way in hell I am losing to him.
Sorry, everyone.
Aoki-san called me and said she would be late.
She said to go on ahead.
Got it.
Should we get drinks or anything?
And we have got to get the room cleaned up.
We should get rid of all the trash there for this.
I think Nakai-san forgot our real objective.
We are not doing this to play around.
This has developed kind of oddly, huh?
We went down to the editorial department about KOOGY,
and now we have ended up showing our names to each other.
He said we were giving opinions.
If it can make each other's work better, it will be fine.
But we are all rivals.
Yeah...
Niizuma-kun is working right now, so he said we could use this room.
Well, I know it is a mess, so just sit anywhere.
Thank you very much.
Excuse me.
I thought our work place was something, but this place is incredible too.
Yeah, I have never been in this room before either.
Every mangaka's workplace looks basically the same as the next one.
Let me help you with that.
No, just get out your name.
Ah, go ahead, I...
Looks like they are here.
We are coming in!
You met Ashirogi-kun this afternoon,
but this is your first time meeting Fukuda-kun, is not it?
This is the original author for my work, Aoki Kou-san.
It is very nice to meet you.
The Story King runner-up king.
I heard she was a woman,
but just what kind of story did she think up?
Nice to meet you.
Please come right over here, Aoki-san.
Have a drink!
Sorry it is in such a confined space.
It is fine, I do not mind.
Guess we are all ready then.
Let us start by reading each other's names.
My KIYOSHI Knight,
team Nakai and Aoki's hideout door,
and Ashirogi Muto's Gitantei TRAP.
Once we have read them all, we will give each other our opinions on their work.
Do not hold anything back.
Be straightforward about anything you notice.
Okay, let us get started.
Excuse me!
This sounds interesting, please let me join in too!
This is Niizuma-sensei.
Sorry for the intrusion.
No problem.
What about your work, Niizuma-kun?
I finished it.
And this looks like something very educational.
I would like to participate!
What do you think?
I would like to have Niizuma-san look at them too.
What about you guys?
I have no objections.
In that case, neither do I.
Okay, then we will have Niizuma-sensei's opinions too.
Thanks very much.
Okay, let us get going.
Right.
A work by an author I do not know at all.
Just what kind of story will it have?
Aw man, Aoki Kou... she is better than I thought she would be.
It seems like the kind of thing you would see in a movie.
It is a story about a boy who meets a fairy and tries to become one himself.
The runner-up Story King is at such a level?
What is with this head-scratcher of a story?
I cannot understand this at all.
But there is nothing like it running in Jack right now.
Did they calculate that far into it?
And I cannot make light of Nakai-san's artwork.
If he uses drawings like these to express a world like this, then...
Fukuda-san...
He said he would polished it using the same character he used for the one shot that ranked 7th in the main magazine...
But it feels almost completely new.
And the feel he gives from these gags is also something we lack.
This is so good!
It feels like a modern-day'Otokojyuku...
The heated parts are incredibly heated, and the comedic parts are hilarious...
Fukuda-san's artwork is the worst among these but the roughness really suits the story...
His partner's better at doing stories...
It is just like Mashiro-kun said...
This guy could even be a writer.
Just as I thought, my biggest rival in this is going to be Ashirogi Muto.
Those two being 15 year old geniuses was not an exaggeration.
The story is amazing, and the drawings are outstanding!
He drew difficult perspectives and poses even at the name stage.
And he has a good sense for splitting the panels up.
When this is done, it will make an incredible work.
What is this guy doing here?!
Exciting!
Well then, how'bout we start giving opinions?
I refuse.
What do you mean?
I think my work is the most interesting, so I am abstaining myself from commenting on other's work.
If you would like to do so, do it with your two groups.
You think this flower field with a candy house in the middle where you eat a giant chocolate cake story is interesting?
I thought it was the most boring out of the bunch.
Fukuda-san...
No, my work was the best.
Your manga was too violent in its expression.
That is because it is shounen manga!
But I will take that too violent comment as a compliment.
But keep in mind that I was told to tone it down and redrew it six times.
Even if I get Yuujirou's approval, if the head editors say no then I cannot go against them.
And the rules got harsher every time.
Though mostly that was just being told not to make it remind people of other old manga.
There are tons of unwholesome shounen manga like that.
They are not holy books or learning material.
Works that are so unwholesome that it would make the PTA oppose it are interesting.
Fukuda-kun, I think that is enough.
Well, fine.
But I am the same, I thought my work was the best.
Did you two think your work was the best too?
Well... yeah.
As a whole.
Well then, I guess we should quit this whole exchanging opinions thing.
If you have faith in your own work, then there is no need.
Yeah, yeah; Aoki-san's right.
My work will not lose to Colorfusical either.
Huh?
You mean our work, right?
Okay, then it is called off!
Fukuda-san...
Aoki-jyou is right, if we have confidence in our work then that is good enough.
It is great that everyone thinks their own work is number one.
So that means we do not need opinions like these.
He is right.
It is not just KOOGY.
All of them are our rivals.
But since we all got together and everything, how about we hear from the most neutral of anyone here, Niizuma-kun.
All three of them were fantastic.
Yeah, but which did you think was most interesting among them?
Violence, suspense, fairy-tale...
Everyone is stories are different, but if I were to rank them on how interesting they were, I would say...
H-Hang on a second, could you?
Okay.
I kind of have a feeling that the real results are going to come out exactly as Niizuma-sensei says.
I do not mind, I have confidence.
I am confident too.
Me too.
Then is it all right for me to say it?
Yeah.
I know which is 3rd, but it is a tie for 1st.
Because of that, I feel sorry for the one in 3rd, so I am not going to say any more.
A tie?
Cannot you pick one of them?
It is an exact tie in my mind!
What is with that?
Cannot you at least try to pick one?
They are really really at the exact same level.
Okay, well we will see which it is when the results come out two months from now.
Is the one to win the Golden Future cup in this room?
Or will it be KOOGY?
I am going home.
Aoki-san, I will accompany you to the train station.
Saikou, let us head back too.
Saikou?
Ah, right.
Good job everyone, I will be looking forward to reading your finished works!
What did we go there for in the end then?
I knew everyone would just like their own works the best.
Otherwise they would not be aiming to be mangakas.
What is wrong?
You have been quiet for a while now.
Which two works got the top results?
Oh, you mean what Eiji said?
Fukuda-san's and Nakai-san's were more interesting than I expected.
I told you, I do not think we will lost to them either.
There is no clear winner!
But that is just Eiji's personal opinion, is not it?
The real thing's only determined by the questionnaires.
With the questionnaires KOOGY has a big advantage.
And KOOGY got a finalist prize in the Tezuka Award.
If he can capture his musical creations in manga...
who knows how it will turn out.
But there is no time until the deadline.
When you are doing the under-sketching, let us revise it a bit.
Okay?
Got it.
Do not worry, the readers will judge them on their content.
KOOGY said he was suspending doing music work!
What a shock, I really liked his outfits.
He said he was becoming a mangaka.
And that the KOOGY world is going to shake the world of manga this time.
First he is going to be an entry in the something-Cup in Shounen Jack.
And he asked that we all support him.
Do you mean the Golden Future Cup?
Ah right, that is it.
But that KOOGY's pretty clever.
Even though it is just the day after the announcement, he is got posters like this everywhere.
Well, it does not matter.
I like KOOGY, so I will support him.
And when his manga becomes an anime, maybe I can audition for the heroine role!
Oh, you just want to meet KOOGY do not you?
Well, I am cheering him on too.
I am a real fan.
Then the three of us should do it together!
You will too, Miho-chan, right?
Y-Yeah...
Junior group, please get ready to perform soon.
Okay!
Let us make sure we make this event a success!
Right!
We have got to work hard to make everyone happy!
Amazing!
They are all boys!
You are right.
Everyone, sorry to keep you waiting.
Looks like it is starting!
The Seivijyo chorus club junior three!
H-Hello everyone.
Today we will sing for the Seivijyo arts festival...
Miho looks pretty nervous.
Good luck Sis!
So please listen.
Symphony Just Before Dawn.
There is nothing else quite like it...
It is still as destructive as how it sounded before.
Sorry.
Please do not give up on those feelings.
Let them all out!
Loving you.
Missing you.
It is heartrending.
and feels like my heart is going to break.
Oh, I cannot watch!
Go ahead and watch.
Look how hard Miho's trying.
That breath, that body of beauty,
I am so happy just from gazing at it.
Hey you two, check this out!
What is this for?
There was a Seivijyo event today in Akihabara.
Afterwards, I made sure to take a picture like this.
Why did not you tell us?
Well, Azuki was embarrassed of course, so she told me not to say anything.
It is even going to be on TV, who cares?
Takagi, you do not understand the hearts of young girls.
That is probably why you are so bad at writing cute heroines in manga.
I do not need help like that.
Miho worked really hard at it.
Well, she could still use some work on her singing,
but by the time she was talking and stuff, by working very hard to get better,
she spoke ten times more than normal.
Really?
Even though she is such a shy person...
Yeah, everyone was really happy.
Who is it from.
Azuki.
Please do not tell her I showed you that photo, okay?
Miho'll get angry.
Are you really that much of an idiot?
What did Azuki say?
She said she believes we can get 1st in the Golden Future Cup.
Really?
Sorry, Shuujin.
I think I will redraw that name after all!
Saikou, are you serious about re-drawing the name?
Eh?
Do you have that much time?
No, but if we do not, we will not be able to beat the other entrants!
I see.
Well, then I will be cheering you on.
Next time, Tuesday and Friday.
Everyone is dreams will finally be attained!
